results.title: On the loose: three stories about leaving school
results.creator_credit: Lyn Norfor, Jane Oehr and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A trilogy about three teenagers seeking their independence in the outside world after finishing school. The three stories show the problems faced by a generation leaving school in the mid 1980s - boredom with school (“Exit Eddie Leech”), sexual pressures in the workplace (“Ring of Confidence”), and keeping a job (“Beginner’s luck”).

results.creator_credit_for_label: Lyn Norfor, Jane Oehr and New South Wales. Dept. of Health

results.title: On the level: a little help from my friends
results.brief_description: Two boys work part-time packing fish on the docks. However, one continually abuses his friendship with the other by failing to keep appointments and not honoring promises. He dismisses his unreliability by saying that his friend will understand and that’s what friends are for. His casual attitude towards his responsibility eventually causes both himself and his friend to lose their jobs. A good discussion starter for addressing issues about expectations of friendship, dishonesty and sexism. Suitable for middle secondary level.

results.title: On the inside
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Michael Adams
results.brief_description: The Outward Bound Training School and its effect on the student’s personality through the four-week course and its new and exciting experiences. The commentary consists mainly of the students’ own thoughts and words as they react to the many physical and mental challenges that they encounter during a course, giving them a deeper understanding of themselves and others.

results.title: On the highway
results.brief_description: Long distance driving on highways needs extra care. David Mackay, a prominent racing driver explains techniques and adds a few tips of his own. Begins with images of the Southern Aurora train as it speeds through the countryside approaching Sydney.

results.title: On the gunline
results.creator_credit: Supreme Films and Department of the Navy
results.brief_description: The Australian guided missile destroyer HMAS Perth at war in Vietnam. Shows the routine of war for the officers and men, self maintenance and preparations at the U.S. Navy base at Subic Bay in the Philippines, underway replenishment of fuel and ammunition and action on the gunline off South Vietnam.

results.title: On the edge of the forest
results.brief_description: Dr E F Schumacher the noted author of the book ‘Small is Beautiful’, describes in clear, elegant and incisive English what man is doing to the forests of southwest Western Australia. Stresses the need for conservation of the Jarrah and Karri forests in order to preserve the unique natural eco-system.

results.title: On the critical path
results.brief_description: Nuclear power plants are not exactly sold on the same scale as wheat, but that they can be manufactured as an exportable commodity is well illustrated in this film. For those familiar with nuclear power generation, and even for the lay audience, this is a lucid exposition of how a nuclear power plant is put together. The film shows the machining and assembly of principal components, and the “on power” operation of the Canadian plant at Pickering, Ontario.

results.title: On such a night
results.brief_description: A visit to Glyndebourne opera by a young American. Intrigued by a group of people in evening dress at Victoria Station, he follows them to Glyndebourne and learns of this centre of opera in an historic country house. Shows excerpts from a performance of Mozart’s The Marriage of Figaro with the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra.
